alert.note: Alert for Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 6:55PM EST until December 24 at 5:30PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by recent rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, and southern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Belknap, Merrimack, Strafford and Sullivan. In northern New Hampshire, Carroll, Coos and Grafton. In southern New Hampshire, Hillsborough and Rockingham. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 646 PM EST, between 1 to 3 inches of rain have fallen. The rainfall will combine with snowmelt to produce additional flooding in the region. Even once the rain has ended, small streams and creeks will continue to rise tonight. - Snow-blocked drainage will exasperate flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Manchester, Nashua, Concord, Derry, Rochester, Merrimack, Portsmouth, Laconia, Hampton, and Durham.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
